messages.subject: RE: [samuraihistory] OT-any likeness to death of Samurai + today's USA anti-male media?
messages.msgSnippet: Curious. How is Hollywoods/advertisment/news media of USA attacking males? Though this sort of conversation probably belongs in a different forum/list
messages.messageBody:
Curious. How is Hollywoods/advertisment/news media of USA attacking
males?

Though this sort of conversation probably belongs in a different
forum/list involving contemporary U.S. politics.

I don't think that this has anything at all to do with the Buke
(Samurai) class being abolished in late 19th century Japan.

Oh, and you mentioned "USA Samurai?" There are no such thing as samurai
in the USA. Samurai were members of the Buke class in Japan who served
daimyo (feudal lords), from around the 10th century until 1867, when the
Buke class was abolished.

Nina



_____

From: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
[mailto:samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com]
Sent: Tuesday, July 18, 2006 4:16 AM
To: samuraihistory@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [samuraihistory] OT-any likeness to death of Samurai + today's
USA anti-male media?



When the Samurai were not needed anymore...they were discarded.
Likewise the USA's media is discarding males...any significance?

In other words, is not Hollywoods/advertisment/news media of USA
attacks on males= the end of USA Samurai? If this question is out of
place, kindly delete.







[Non-text portions of this message have been removed]
